meanings.sent1: The gypseous rocks had a white, chalky appearance.
meanings.sent2: The walls of the cave were covered in gypseous crystals.
meanings.sent3: The artist painted a gypseous landscape with gypsum-like mountains.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as gypseous as the gypsum rocks in the desert.
meanings.sent5: The gypseous soil sparkled in the sunlight, resembling gypsum crystals.

meanings.sent1: The miner studied the gypseous properties of the gypsum deposit.
meanings.sent2: The geologist explained the gypseous nature of the rock formation.
meanings.sent3: The gypseous scent of the gypsum mine filled the air.
meanings.sent4: Her dress shimmered with a gypseous glow, reminiscent of gypsum.
meanings.sent5: The gypseous texture of the gypsum wall felt rough to the touch.

meanings.sent1: The construction material was chosen for its gypseous content.
meanings.sent2: The statue was crafted from a gypseous mixture of gypsum and clay.
meanings.sent3: The gypseous taste of the gypsum water surprised the hikers.
meanings.sent4: The gypseous clouds in the sky resembled floating gypsum formations.
meanings.sent5: The gypseous quality of the gypsum block made it easy to carve.
